General.Name: Green Cross Corp
General.Description: GC Biopharma Corp., a biopharmaceutical company, develops drugs and vaccines in South Korea. The company provides plasma derivatives, including albumin, immunoglobulin, and antithrombin; and vaccines for hepatitis-B, Hantavirus hemorrhagic fever, influenza, flu, and varicella. It also offers prescription drugs for the bleeding symptom control and hemostasis for persons with hemophilia A; prevention and treatment of bleeding episodes induced by hemophilia A and post-operative treatment; and treatment of neutropenia, hunter syndrome, and liver cancer, as well as treatment of anti-inflammation, pain relief, and osteoarthritis. In addition, the company provides over the counter drugs. It also exports its products to approximately 50 countries. The company has a licensing and collaboration agreement with Tottori University for development of GM1 gangliosidosis chaperone therapy. GC Biopharma Corp. was founded in 1967 and is headquartered in Yongin-si, South Korea. GC Biopharma Corp. is a subsidiary of Green Cross Holdings Corporation.
